_exec_summary.SummaryText:
ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICIS:

Passive release prevention efforts include placement of the storage tanks at the rear of the property where they are not likely to be struck by a vehicle.

Active prevention measures include inspection of all tanks annually, at the end of the season.  All required repairs are performed at that time.  Further inspections are performed semi annually by the Missouri Department of Ag.

Emergency response policies are as described below:

FACILITY DESCRIPTION AND REGULATED SUBSTANCES HANDLED:

This facility is located just outside of Boonville, Missouri.  It has 2 anhydous ammonia tanks, 26,000 and 12,000 gallons capacity.

WORST CASE RELEASE SCENARIOS AND ALTERNATE RELEASE SCENARIOS:

The worst case scenario for the anhydrous ammonia operation envisions a catastrophic failure of the storage tank, possibly preceded by failure of the relief valves.  Regulatory and procedural controls limit the amount of anhydrous ammonia in the tank to 80% of capacity.  Using RMP*COMP, the toxic endpoint was calculated at 3.6 miles.  This would include virtually the entire town of Boonville.

Alterrnate release scenarios could involve a hose failure allowing product to escape.  The toxic endpoint for anhydrous ammonia would be 0.5 miles.

GENERAL ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM AND CHEMICAL SPECIFIC PREVENTION STEPS:

This facility complies with 29 CFR 1910.111 (anhydrous ammonia)

FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY:

There have been no accidents involving releases of anhydrous ammonia in the last 5 years.

EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM:

This facility is located just outside of the city limits of Boonville, Mo. Employees will notify the fire department in the event of a major release.  Trained employees are authorized to take appropriate actions to stop small releases by shutting off valves, etc.  Other employees will notify the fire department and evacuate the area as necessary.  There is a written emergency respone plan in place

that is for the use of and applies only to company employees.  This plan includes evacuation procedures, who is authorized to take emergency actions to control a release, notification and alarm procedures, as well as other information.

PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY:

There are currently no changes to the safety/release prevention programs planned.
